attributes.action: Make  London underground more friendly to wheelchair and with children in prams
attributes.additional_details: I have to wait for a kind person to help with stairs then put a pram on a very tall escalator this is very dangerous  this would have been imposable for a wheelchair user I did a journey the other day from Stratford to Green gate it was so easy no asking people for help both stations had lifts  this is what we need the London underground needs shaking up one day there is going to be an accident as people tend to push past the pram when you are on an escalator the government need to act on this .
attributes.background: As a mum with a 15 month old baby I have found it so difficult traveling round the London underground with a pram wheelchair users are in the same boat you have to find wheelchair friendly stations and it takes you miles out where you want to go all underground station needs lifts not just a few .

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the London Assembly.
Transport for London is accountable to the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
